# ASCIIColors Quick Start
## What is it?
ASCIIColors is a unified Python library for terminal styling â€” colors, styles, progress bars, interactive menus, and logging in one toolkit.
```bash pip install ascii_colors ```
---
## Core Pattern
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors
# Print with color ASCIIColors.red("Error message") ASCIIColors.green("Success!") ASCIIColors.yellow("Warning", style=ASCIIColors.style_bold)
# Full control ASCIIColors.print( "Text", color=ASCIIColors.color_cyan, background=ASCIIColors.color_bg_white, style=ASCIIColors.style_underline ) ```
---
## Color Reference
| Foreground | Background | Bright Foreground | Bright Background | |-----------|-----------|-------------------|-------------------| | `color_black` | `color_bg_black` | `color_bright_black` | `color_bg_bright_black` | | `color_red` | `color_bg_red` | `color_bright_red` | `color_bg_bright_red` | | `color_green` | `color_bg_green` | `color_bright_green` | `color_bg_bright_green` | | `color_yellow` | `color_bg_yellow` | `color_bright_yellow` | `color_bg_bright_yellow` | | `color_blue` | `color_bg_blue` | `color_bright_blue` | `color_bg_bright_blue` | | `color_magenta` | `color_bg_magenta` | `color_bright_magenta` | `color_bg_bright_magenta` | | `color_cyan` | `color_bg_cyan` | `color_bright_cyan` | `color_bg_bright_cyan` | | `color_white` | `color_bg_white` | `color_bright_white` | `color_bg_bright_white` | | `color_orange` | `color_bg_orange` | â€” | â€” |
---
## Style Modifiers
| Style | Effect | |-------|--------| | `style_bold` | Bold/Bright | | `style_dim` | Dim/Faint | | `style_italic` | Italic | | `style_underline` | Underline | | `style_blink` | Slow blink | | `style_reverse` | Reverse video | | `style_hidden` | Hidden text | | `style_strikethrough` | Strikethrough |
Combine: `ASCIIColors.style_bold + ASCIIColors.style_underline`
---
## Common Patterns
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors
# Status indicators ASCIIColors.green("âœ“ Success") ASCIIColors.red("âœ— Failed") ASCIIColors.yellow("âš Warning") ASCIIColors.blue("â„¹ Info")
# Multicolor line ASCIIColors.multicolor( ["Status: ", "ACTIVE", " | Load: ", "85%"], [ASCIIColors.color_white, ASCIIColors.color_green, ASCIIColors.color_white, ASCIIColors.color_yellow] )
# Highlight patterns in text ASCIIColors.highlight( "ERROR: Connection failed at line 42", subtext=["ERROR", "failed"], highlight_color=ASCIIColors.color_bright_red )
# Conditional coloring status_color = ASCIIColors.color_green if success else ASCIIColors.color_red ASCIIColors.print(f"Result: {result}", color=status_color)
# Compose without printing styled = ASCIIColors.red("Error: ", emit=False, end="") styled += ASCIIColors.bold("Critical", emit=False) print(styled) ```
---
## Quick Components
| Need | Use | |------|-----| | Simple colored print | `ASCIIColors.red("text")` | | Full styling control | `ASCIIColors.print(..., color=, background=, style=)` | | Inline color changes | `ASCIIColors.multicolor()` | | Pattern highlighting | `ASCIIColors.highlight()` | | Progress bars | `ProgressBar()` | | Interactive menus | `Menu()` | | User prompts | `questionary` module | | Structured logging | `import ascii_colors as logging` |
